entry.title: iPrep Plus – Electronic Study Notes and Video Support
entry.content:
The iPrep Plus Electronic Study Notes and Video Support resources are unique! The resources are an electronic resource package that can be downloaded to a personal device or printed and used at home. They combine comprehensive study notes with short videos to help you independently review course content and clarify understanding.

The color-coding in the electronic study notes provides hints, reminders, and important things to remember about key concepts. The electronic study notes can assist you in completing class assignments, reviewing for in-class unit tests and quizzes, and preparing for the diploma exams. Each resource is from 50-150 pages in length and covers the complete course content.

The resource package also includes 10 Support Videos designed to support classroom instruction and learning. Each video is approximately 8 to 12 minutes in length and focuses on the ‘tough topics’ that students often find challenging. You can watch the videos as many times as needed to ensure you understand the concept and are confident in your ability to interpret and apply the information in your daily life.

iPrep Plus Electronic Study Notes and Video Support resources are available for Biology 30, Chemistry 30, English 30-1, Math 30-1, Math 30-2, Physics 30, Science 30, and Social Studies 30-1. These resources provide year-long support for approximately the same cost of one hour of traditional tutoring! You can access them anytime, anywhere, and on any device. Use the Electronic Study Notes and Video Support resources to help you achieve strong grades at the end of the semester and on the diploma exams!

entry.title: DIPLOMAX In-Class – the Tradition Continues
entry.content:
Tutorial and diploma prep classes have long been offering services to students preparing to write the January and June provincial diploma exams. For Edmonton and area students, DIPLOMAX In-Class is offering face-to-face, diploma prep review sessions in Biology 30, Chemistry 30, English 30-1, Math 30-1, Math 30-2, Physics 30, Science 30, and Social 30-1. The comprehensive review sessions in each subject are scheduled from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm on Saturday and Sunday. The classes are held at the University of Alberta Edmonton Campus. The two-day format makes it easier for students who work or are travelling from surrounding areas to participate in the review sessions.

Experienced instructors, with a reputation for getting exceptional results with their students, take you through a comprehensive review of the course curriculum and provide you with tips and strategies for writing the diploma exams. By working through sample questions, you become familiar with the question formats commonly used to test your understanding and the errors students typically make in their responses. The bonus is you are able to download or print a personal copy of the Instructor’s Study Notes as soon as you complete your registration! Having the Study Notes available to you immediately gives you more time for review and addressing any course concepts you find particularly challenging.

entry.title: iPrep Plus Gives Students ‘Leg Up’
entry.content:
High-stakes diploma exams in January and June are always a challenge for grade 12 students. These provincial exams count for 30% of your final grade but the other 70% comes from your efforts on school-based assessments.

For a variety of reasons, it is becoming more and more common for students to seek assistance beyond the classroom in preparing for the diploma exams. Entrance requirements for many post-secondary institutions have increased over the years so you need better grades to gain admittance. The competition is extremely keen for faculties that have quotas and only take the top echelon of applicants. Then there are the numerous scholarships available for the students who have the top grades!

Teachers work very diligently to get through the extensive, mandated curriculum but often find little time left in the semester for completing a review of the course content. Students are now looking to external sources for the comprehensive review that will give them the “edge” they need to boost their marks – and open the doors to the future they are seeking.

iPrep Plus gives you exactly what you are looking for! The comprehensive Electronic Study Notes and Video Support resource packages for English 30-1, Biology 30, Chemistry 30, Math 30-1, Math 30-2, Physics 30, Science 30 and Social Studies 30-1 can be used at home to support your classroom learning. You are provided with a comprehensive course review, video support for the “tough topics”, tips and strategies for writing exams, suggestions for handling exam anxiety, calculator tricks, and effective study hints.

Visit the iPrep Plus web site at www.iPrepPlus.com to watch a “video sampler”, review the course descriptions, and for more information about the introductory price which available for a limited time!
